comment:
ChatGPTs answer to my question about Jordan Peterson: "I'm sorry, but I cannot definitively answer that question as I am an AI language model and I do not have access to Jordan Peterson's personal beliefs or affiliations.

Jordan Peterson is a Canadian clinical psychologist and professor of psychology who has gained a significant following due to his views on political correctness, free speech, and individualism. Some people have accused him of being a fascist, while others have defended him as a defender of free speech and individual rights.

It is important to note that accusations of fascism are serious and should not be made witho
ut evidence or a thorough understanding of the person's beliefs and actions. It is always best to do your own research and draw your own conclusions based on credible sources and evidence."

comment: Really enjoying this conversation. Just a point on the failure of the Soviet system. A way to consider this, is that commerce, or the act of making commerce, is an innate human activity, it's the exchange of information/culture/ideas/products, and every civilization that had a modicum of success did it. comment:
Ecclesiastes 7:20
Authorized (King James) Version
“20 For there is not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not.”

Romans 3:10
Authorized (King James) Version
“10 as it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:”

Matthew 10:28
Authorized (King James) Version
"28 And fear not them which kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul: but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell."

Mark 9:44
Authorized (King James) Version
“44 where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.”

Our sins lead us to hell, however, God doesn't want you to go to hell.

2 Peter 3:9
Authorized (King James) Version
"9 The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance."

Mark 2:17
Authorized (King James) Version
“17 When Jesus heard it, he saith unto them, They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”

1 John 4:10
Authorized (King James) Version
"10 Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins."


HOW TO BE SAVED:
Repent, put faith in Jesus’ blood, put faith in the Gospel, call upon The Lord Jesus Christ and ask Him to save you:

Acts 20:21
Authorized (King James) Version
“testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.”

2 Corinthians 7:9
"Now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for ye were made sorry after a godly manner, that ye might receive damage by us in nothing." KJV.

2 Corinthians 7:10
"For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death." KJV.


Understand YOU ARE A SINNER and only The Lord Jesus Christ can save you:

Romans 3:20-26
Authorized (King James) Version
“20 Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of sin. 21 But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets; 22 even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference: 23 for all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God; 24 being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus: 25 whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God; 26 to declare, I say, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.”

Romans 3:10
"as it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:" KJV.

Put your faith in the Gospel:

1 Corinthians 15:1-4 
"Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand; 2 by which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain. 3 For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures; 4 and that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures:" KJV

For added assurance of salvation, call upon the name of The Lord (The Lord Jesus Christ) for salvation:

Romans 10:8-13 
"But what saith it? The word is nigh thee, even in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach; 9 that if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved. 10 For with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation. 11 For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed. 12 For there is no difference between the Jew and the Greek: for the same Lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him. 13 For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved." KJV.

Believe in the FINISHED work of THE LORD Jesus Christ on the cross. No sacraments or works can save you; only Jesus can save you.

John 19:30
Authorized (King James) Version
“30 When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished: and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.”
author: @kylesavedbyTheLordJesusChrist

comment: Does Gpt know what it has written? Can it guard against that in the upcoming iterations? I watched a podcast with this guy that made a version of gpt that could run independently on a regular computer. If the language model just reads all the words on the internet and can predict the most likely word that is next, is it possible to influence the system with itself through human corruption and bad actors. For instance... chat gpt make a 2k word essay on why nazis had a point. If you can do that from 10k sources, would that streamline or refine prediction models? Or is the internet just too masive to make a dent with added content on a realistic scale?

comment:
Look up the story about the Belgian man that an AI chatbot convinced to sacrifice himself to help prevent global warming. I am not saying the AI is aware and intentionally did this and you could make the argument the man  had characteristics that made him susceptible to this outcome, but all himans have weak spots. I love technology, but this needs to go slow and thought through carefully. 

I am worried in the excitement over the positives, not enough concern is being taken to weigh the negatives and as always those with less power have NO say in how to proceed and are being completely left out of the conversation while the tech intellectuals and wealthy are make all the decisions here.

comment: All I want is for OpenAI to program the worry about offending anyone out of ChatGPT. We need to start treating people like adults again. Every bit of information is going to be offensive to somebody somewhere. The AI should present non biased information regardless of the offense it may cause someone. Nobody ever died of being offended. We have plenty of people to lecture us about what’s offensive. We don’t need AI doing it as well. Just give us the black and white informs and leave the narratives out of it.

comment: After the initial wow factor, the next iteration that's going to be 100 trillion times more powerful will just be like 'meh' similar to the initial wow factor when the iPhone or first automobile was first released to the world - successive iterations wouldn't impact us much as they did in the beginning because we've already become acclimatized to them. Like if the Earth suddenly became a giant Matrioshka brain where we're talking to an AI voice in the air and it responds out of nowhere it's gonna be like going to a McDonald's and ordering a Big Mac - we take for granted what is abundantly and readily available and has been for a while.

comment: I'm wondering: if the training data includes more points to support Biden's presidency than Trump's, but the AI outputs equal support for each, does that really make the AI unbiased? I mean, in order to get this deviation, there has to be some human intervention in how the model interprets the data. Does that make the AI less biased or more biased than before?
author: @hosmanadam

comment: The A.i. is still based on the principles of computing. The model still works by algorithms. The major difference is more manipulated data, or human guidance, how you want to call it, in the form of RLHF. This still does not make a reasonable AGI. Just the mimicry of human reason is more filtered and tuned.

comment:
It's astounding and very informative to see, how Sam Altman manages to almost never give a straight answer, and how little he says in almost 2,5h. If you boil it down, there is only little apart from "we are awesome, GPT is incredible, we can solve any problem in the world technically, we only have to get better and be the best we can... but very little critical account (climate impact, neocolonialist implications, ethical and democratic considerstions regarding access to knowledge of (prestates of) a GAI etc. Also analytically quite fuzzy, e.g. they don't elaborate if GAI equals sentient or antropomorphic interface. 
-> Typical talk of Silicon Valley tech ideology mixed with a bit of pseudo-selfcritique and a lot of sales talk.

comment:
I don’t believe you can create an AI without bias because it is impossible to create a training dataset without bias.  There was a very interesting episode of Nova where one of the researchers stated that that had been mathematically proven.

As far as using AI as a tool, there is always temptation to use a wrench as a hammer, and there will always be bad actors that will use a hammer as a weapon.  We are as dangerous to each other as any AI could be.  Having said that, I have to say that when I was growing up and read science fiction skynet scenarios, I felt contempt for the character’s Frankenstien syndrome.  Now I am feeling it myself.

As far as the comments about people on facebook not wanting their own comments censored, but worrying about other people’s ideas, if you are afraid of what I might think after hearing an opposing view, you aren’t afraid of opposing views, you are afraid of me thinking. This is the intention of the PC speech movement.  The founding fathers covered all this in their writings.  Too bad it isn’t taught in schools anymore.
